post_text: Yesterday our district custodial staff received training on our new electrostatic backpack sprayers. SCPS purchased one for each school to efficiently and routinely disinfect our buildings and school buses. Using a completely safe and non-toxic disinfectant with these sprayers allows SCPS custodial staff to neutralize COVID-19 (and many other pathogens) on surfaces within 4 minutes of its application! School buses will be sprayed after each run, and classrooms, offices and building common areas will be sprayed nightly. Bathrooms will be sprayed each hour throughout the school day. All of this will be done in addition to our routine cleaning practices to keep our buildings safe for students and staff. Can we get a round of applause for our heroes in custodial services?! 👏👏👏 #TeamSCPS #SmallButMighty #CleanSchoolsAreHealthySchools

What does 2018-2019 Maryland Teacher of the Year Dr. Richard Warren love about teaching in Maryland?

"I remember being jobless and going into the school system as a substitute, as I began to teach the kids I began to see pieces of my own story within some of the students that I taught. The challenges that they had to overcome, the obstacles that they were facing, and I felt as though I was the person to inspire them to move forward. Those kind of stories and students really hit home for me."

Read more about Dr. Warren's story: https://teach.in.maryland.gov/

November 21, 2019 at 9:05 AM ·

Please share! Please share! Please share!

I have received a call from the Town of Crisfield and they have to turn the water off for an extended period of time. We are in the middle of picking up Woodson students and will bring them to school. Because of the length of the shut off we will not have water to flush toilets, run sinks or run our kitchen. Therefore we will be dismissing Crisfield High School at 9 o’clock and Woodson at 10 o’clock. We are sorry for any issues this causes, however, it is out of our control. Teachers are to stay until all students have been dismissed.

I do not know whether or not we have to make this day up. Again Crisfield High School dismisses at 9 and Woodson at 10.￼￼￼￼￼￼

Dr. John B. Gaddis, Superintendent of Somerset County Public Schools
November 20, 2019 at 11:20 PM ·

Day 53 was all about getting out of the office and interacting with the students!!!!! ￼

The day started with a meeting with the SEA over at the new technical high school. While there we visited several classrooms and saw students engaged in some great activities!￼

After that it was off to Washington High School where we checked out their Community Day with all of the various groups and activities from the school, represented in the front foyer.￼ It was great to interact with the students and see community members checking out all the school has to offer. There is so much positive going on at the school that is overlooked!

Next we attended the Promotion Ceremony for students in the Criminal Justice Program at the technical high school.￼ It was an honor to be able to pin new rank pins on the students!￼ Below is Deputy Superintendent Tom Davis doing the same thing!￼

What a great day!!!!!

See you tomorrow!!!!

#TeamSCPS
#SmallButMighty
